item.title: Learning Ruby: Classes & Objects
item.description:
Classes in ruby are first-class objects. Each is an instance of class Class

A class can be defined simply as:

class House
end

item.title: Learning Ruby: Loops & Blocks
item.description:
A loop is a control structure that allows you to repeatedly execute a block of code.

loop do
	puts "I'm looping..."
end

item.title: Learning Ruby: Methods & Functions
item.description: Methods are a way to encapsulate and provide names for ruby expressions. It helps avoid code duplication, so we can keep calling the same methods when we need them.
